did.unittitle: Sharing Technology for Research, Education, and New Media (STREAM) Records

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Sharing Technology for Research, Education, and New Media (STREAM) became active at Tufts University in the early 2010s. It is an interdisciplinary faculty-based effort to share information and ideas about using technology to support learning and teaching. STREAM is hosted by the Tufts Center for the Enhancement of Learning and Teaching (CELT).

STREAM's goals have included raising funds for student tablets, creating collaborative student learning spaces distributed across campus and supported by current technology, and improving projection capabilities at Olin Center.

scopecontent.head: Steven Gentry's Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of one digital video recording. The presentations in this video recording address Social Book (a piece of software that allows users to post texts and then invite other users to read that text) and smartphysics.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into one series: STREAM lectures.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. did.unittitle: STREAM Presentations on Social Book and Smartphysics

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kris Manjapra, Nancy Bauer, Ioannis Evrigenis, David Hammer, Roger Tobin discuss technology solutions for teaching at the STREAM meeting.
